Class FileStorage

  • java.lang.Object
    • FileStorage

  • public class FileStorage
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FileStorage()
      This constructor gets the file storage path at the start of the application

      This methods copy the content of the old file to a new file

      This methods delete a specific line of the content in the storage file
      void deleteTask(int taskNumber) 
      FileData display()
      This methods retrieve and returns the content of the storage file
      FileData getData()
      This methods gets the content of the storage file Create a hash map to map the original content of the storage file to its original sequence Create a hash map to map the content in its new sequence which is sorted in ascending order Create a new FileData to store the two hash map
      java.lang.String getFilePath()
      The methods retrieve and return the current directory of the storage file

        This method writes the user's input text data into the storage file

        This methods updates and set the new storage file path
        Parameters:
        newPath - the new storage location which the user wants to store his data

      • display

        This methods retrieve and returns the content of the storage file

      • search

        public FileData search(java.lang.String keyword)
        This methods retrieve and returns the content of the storage file which contains a particular key word
        Parameters:
        keyword - the key word to find a specific content in the storage file
        Returns:
        the content of the storage file which contains only the key word

      • delete

        public void delete(java.lang.String line,
                   FileData data)
        This methods delete a specific line of the content in the storage file
        Parameters:
        line - the line number of the line which is to be deleted
        data - the FileData which contains the hash map that links the line number to content of the storage file

      • getData

        public FileData getData()
        This methods gets the content of the storage file Create a hash map to map the original content of the storage file to its original sequence Create a hash map to map the content in its new sequence which is sorted in ascending order Create a new FileData to store the two hash map
        Returns:
        the FileData which contents two hash map

      • readFile

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> readFile()
        Retrieve and return the content of the storage file The content of the storage file is stored in a ArrayList
        Returns:
        the ArrayList which contains the content of the storage file
